title: Random lagspikes ONLY DURING a CLASH/FIGHT
body:
So recently i've been having this annoying lagspikes that ONLY APPEARS DURING A FIGHT/CLASH where my ping will suddenly go 100-500. then after the fight, (or when im not moving or attacking any enemy) ping goes down to 16....but the moment I attack an enemy, it will began to randomly go 100-500 ping...
I'm not sure if its the LoL or not..
I tried other games to see if the same thing happens , my ping is normal and doesnt do this random lagspikes..( btw my laptop is the only device that is connected to the net)
I tried directly connecting my laptop to the modem ...still the same.. random lagspikes ONLY DURING A FIGHT...

so yeah...at first it didnt bother me because it rarely happens but now it ALWAYS happen (this issue started last week  and up until now)
anyway...any idea whats happening? : /
_
PS: its not my FPS the one thats dropping its my MS_

replies.body:
Could you do the following for me to help better determine the nature of your issues,

* [Switch to a public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5)
* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the direct url to your ICSI netalyzr results.

HEYYY... i'm sorry it took time before i replied...i was busy playing urf LOL (i'm still having that random lag spikes, but in urf...well it doesnt really matter haha)

.. I did the first second and third step but i was kinda hesitant to do the 4th one (run ICSI netalyzr) because its asking me to install java first..
and this is just something personal but i had security risk with java before...so if its alright, i didnt do the that step ;/ (i know its selfish but....i dont want to risk my laptop anymore)....
 if this issue wont be resolve without the result of ICSI netalyzr, then alright, its fine i'll just have to play along with the issue

anyway...if you still need it, here's the result with the WinMTR:

[WinMTR result](http://pastebin.com/raw/Wy2T7GgG)

http://pastebin.com/raw/Wy2T7GgG

Hey there,

Nothing seems too bad with that MTR, are you still experiencing this issue?

Does this only occur during "peak" times?

Have you attempted to contact your ISP regarding your issues?

yeahh.... im still experiencing it
and yes it happens during "peak" time as well.. esp when i began dive haha

no...cause...well, it only happens in LoL and there seems nothing wrong with my IS so....

anyway if it cant be fix...then alright.... i'll just play along..

Hey there,

By "peak" times, I meant real world time (ie; when everyone gets home from school/work, on the weekends, etc).

Also even though every other service may be functioning correctly that does not rule out your ISP as being the culprit, I'd still try contacting them.
same here my ms is jumping to 300 from 60ms randomly aswell!
You're not the only one having this issue. I'm also having weird jumps to like 300+ ping out of nowhere. I'd really like some feedback from Riot on this.
